elements.text:
Okay I want you all to see what made me start to 180 from Rust.

Here's some code I wrote, figure, if I can't make a graph, I can't use a language.
Basically my brain exploded. I don't think I am at a place where I can think like this right now(&mut is fine but the Copy, usize thing is

text: I don't know how useful it is to pursue this example: I've not seen the `use: From<T>` syntax before, but it is clearly an attempt at not writing `T: Into<usize>` , which I totally support and approve of. But maybe using the `Into<usize>` makes it evident what is happening here: <https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=fb2a6502715406d7e5805811f6fa55fe>.
